intro: Echinops szowitzii, commonly known as the spiked centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble small globes. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the summer months. Echinops szowitzii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its distinctive appearance and drought tolerance.
